title: How would you describe everyday life in writing? - Quora

response.answer_text: Um… paraphrasing? Here’s the thing: what is that ‘everyday life’ doing for the story? I mean, you can show a lot about a character by what they wear and how they go about their day. You can even evoke sympathy, like if the character is a little girl that tiptoes in her stockings because she’s terrified of waking her father, passed out drunk on the couch. You can set it up as a contrast between the mundane and the magical for when supernatural story stuff goes. However, if you story is just life… well, I live that. Unless your life is more interesting than mine, I probably won’t be reading it.

How would you describe everyday life in writing? Everyday life? I say perspective. Life is so full, it is a complete system, its universal and astoundingley balanced. So i ask how do i percieve it? Is it the angles i see it from, or the location i reside. In any of these answers forms of perception, We can fathom and appreciate that we see very little of the whole. How i deescribe life? I see what i need to see, i will find what i am searching for, but all in all i have what i need.
